block.p: Sharon Allegra Molinoff, the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Perry B. Molinoff of Weston, Conn., was married last evening to Christopher Scott Sevrens, the son of Mr. and Mrs. James E. Sevrens of San Mateo, Calif. Rabbi Nathaniel Benjamin performed the ceremony at Tappan Hill in Tarrytown, N.Y.

Mrs. Sevrens, 28, and Mr. Sevrens, 33, work at Merrill Lynch in New York. She is an associate who provides investment banking services for media and entertainment companies; he is a vice president working with investment bankers, salesmen and traders on the pricing of high-yield bonds and other noninvestment-grade debt instruments.

Sharon Allegra Molinoff, the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Perry B. Molinoff of Weston, Conn., was married last evening to Christopher Scott Sevrens, the son of Mr. and Mrs. James E. Sevrens of San Mateo, Calif. Rabbi Nathaniel Benjamin performed the ceremony at Tappan Hill in Tarrytown, N.Y.

Mrs. Sevrens, 28, and Mr. Sevrens, 33, work at Merrill Lynch in New York. She is an associate who provides investment banking services for media and entertainment companies; he is a vice president working with investment bankers, salesmen and traders on the pricing of high-yield bonds and other noninvestment-grade debt instruments.

The bride graduated and received an M.B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania. Her father is the vice president, in Wallingford, Conn., for the neuroscience drug discovery division of Bristol-Myers Squibb, the pharmaceutical company. Her mother, Dr. Marlene S. Molinoff, is the associate creative director at Lally, McFarland & Pantello, a pharmaceutical advertising agency in New York.

The bridegroom graduated cum laude from Claremont McKenna College and received an M.B.A. from the University of California at Los Angeles. His mother, Bonnie J. Sevrens, is the acting benefits coordinator at the College of Notre Dame in Belmont, Calif. His father is the general manager of The San Francisco Examiner.
